description: North Korea establishes a emergency system against Coronavirus
North Korea establishes a emergency system against Coronavirus UPDATE: North Korea declared a state of emergency for the Kaesong area on July 24.

North Korea strengthens sanitary inspection projects at borders, ports and airfields by taking thorough quarantine measures, prohibiting travels to epidemic-spreading areas, and quarantining all suspected patients.

description: On May 18th, North Korean authorities issued an order instructing the country’s schools to be thoroughly sterilized and for disease control measures to be implemented ahead of the start of school on June 1.

description: The North Korean Ministry of Education instructed all universities, elementary, middle and high schools to disinfect all classrooms from June 29 to June 30 in cooperation with provincial, city and county disease prevention authorities, and to lock classroom doors and affix them with “paper seals”.

description: North Korean authorities ordered hospital workers to stay silent about patients who died of Covid-19
type_text: This policy can not be classified as Anti-Disinformation measure because it is not based on science. Patients showed symptoms of Covid-19 and died, and it appears that the North Korean authorities do not want to population to know that this is happening.
